# init(preferredCompactColumn:sidebar:content:detail:)

**Initializer**

Creates a three-column navigation split view that enables programmatic control over which column appears on top when the view collapses into a single column in narrow sizes.

## Declaration

```swift
nonisolated init(preferredCompactColumn: Binding<NavigationSplitViewColumn>, @ViewBuilder sidebar: () -> Sidebar, @ViewBuilder content: () -> Content, @ViewBuilder detail: () -> Detail)
```

## Parameters

- **preferredCompactColumn**: A [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Binding] to state that controls which column appears on top when the view collapses.
- **sidebar**: The view to show in the leading column.
- **content**: The view to show in the middle column.
- **detail**: The view to show in the detail area.

## Specifying a preferred compact column

- **init(preferredCompactColumn:sidebar:detail:)**: Creates a two-column navigation split view that enables programmatic control over which column appears on top when the view collapses into a single column in narrow sizes.
